conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the image and understand the flow of liquid through the baffles.
The image shows different colored lines labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, and G, which represent the paths of liquid flow. The arrows indicate the direction of flow through the baffles.
The arrows labeled A, B, and C indicate the paths of liquid flow through the baffles.
The path of liquid flow through the baffles needs to be followed to identify the container (D, E, or F) that the liquid will flow into.
The path labeled A flows through the baffles and leads to container D.
The path labeled B flows through the baffles and leads to container E.
The path labeled C flows through the baffles and leads to container F.
The liquid will flow into the container that the path labeled A passes through. Based on the image, the path labeled A will flow into container D.
